text: Nocturnal (1961) for soprano, male choir, and orchestra, is a musical composition by Edgard Varèse with text consisting of syllables by Varèse and words and phrases adapted from House of Incest by Anaïs Nin (1936), revised and completed posthumously by Chou Wen-chung (1968), The piece is commissioned by and dedicated to the Koussevitzky Music Foundation,"Nocturnal (1961)", ChouWenchung.org. published 1972. It includes music for flexatone and two ondes Martenots.Daniels, David (2005). Orchestral Music: A Handbook, p.399. . The use of Dada-like "meta-language" in Ecuatorial and in Nocturnal was suggested by Antonin Artaud.Bramble, John and Bradley, Peter T. (2015). Modernism and the Occult, unpaginated. Springer. . The premier was conducted by Robert Craft at The Town Hall in New York on May 1, 1961. ==References== Category:1961 compositions Category:1972 compositions Category:Compositions by Edgard Varèse Category:Modernist compositions Category:Music commissioned by Serge Koussevitzky or the Koussevitzky Music Foundation Category:Compositions for orchestra Category:Vocal musical compositions
title: Nocturnal (Varèse)
